sen.j: 勧善懲悪（かんぜんちょうあく）とは「善を勧め、悪を懲しめる」ことを意味する四字熟語である。
sen.e: Kanzen Choaku is a compound word made up of four characters: 勧(kan), 善(zen), 懲(cho) and 悪(aku) and means encouraging good and punishing evil.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Kanzen Choaku is a compound word made up of four characters: 勧(kan), 善(zen), 懲(cho) and 悪(aku) and means encouraging good and punishing evil.
Kanzen Choaku is a compound word made up of four characters: 勧(kan), 善(zen), 懲(cho) and 悪(aku) and means encouraging good and punishing evil.

sen.j: 古典文学上の理念や倫理である。
sen.e: It is an ideology or ethic in classical literature.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is an ideology or ethic in classical literature.
It is an ideology or ethic in classical literature.

sen.j: 勧懲（かんちょう）と略して使われることもある。
sen.e: The abbreviated word, Kancho, is also used.
The abbreviated word, Kancho, is also used.
The abbreviated word, Kancho, is also used.

sen.j: 『勧善懲悪』の文学様式は、時代劇や多くのハリウッド映画、特撮に於けるシナリオにおける典型的パターンである。
sen.e: The Kanzen Choaku style in literature is typical of the scenarios in period dramas, many Hollywood movies and special-effect films.
The Kanzen Choaku style in literature is typical of the scenarios in period dramas, many Hollywood movies and special-effect films.
The Kanzen Choaku style in literature is typical of the scenarios in period dramas, many Hollywood movies and special-effect films.

sen.j: これは善玉（正義若しくは善人）と、悪玉（悪役・悪党・搾取する権力者など）が明確に分かれている。
sen.e: In these scenarios, the virtuous one (e.g. justice or a good man) and the evil one (e.g. a villain, a bad man, or an abusive authority) are clearly distinguished.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In these scenarios, the virtuous one (e.g. justice or a good man) and the evil one (e.g. a villain, a bad man, or an abusive authority) are clearly distinguished.
In these scenarios, the virtuous one (e.g. justice or a good man) and the evil one (e.g. a villain, a bad man, or an abusive authority) are clearly distinguished.

sen.j: 最後には悪玉が善玉に打ち倒され、滅ぼされたり悔恨するという形で終結する。
sen.e: The scenarios always finish with evil being defeated by good and with evil being doomed or remorseful.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The scenarios always finish with evil being defeated by good and with evil being doomed or remorseful.
The scenarios always finish with evil being defeated by good and with evil being doomed or remorseful.

sen.j: 一般にはハッピーエンドとされる形で物語は終幕を迎えるパターンである。
sen.e: The stories finish with a so-called happy ending.
In general, the stories finish with a so-called happy ending.
sen.cmt: 訳抜け、「一般的には」を補足しました。
sen.e: In general, the stories finish with a so-called happy ending.

sen.j: 近世江戸時代に、儒教で見られる政治や道徳に対する思想と、江戸幕府が打ち出した政治や道徳観の教育・方針の影響を受けて生まれた理念である。
sen.e: In the early modern age, the Edo period, political or moral ideologies seen in Confucianism and the influence of the political policy and the educational concept, which the Edo bakufu (a Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) set forth, gave rise to the ideology of Kanzen Choaku.

In the early modern age, the Edo period, political or moral ideologies seen in Confucianism and the influence of the political policy and the educational concept, which the Edo bakufu (a Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) set forth, gave rise to the ideology of Kanzen Choaku.

In the early modern age, the Edo period, political or moral ideologies seen in Confucianism and the influence of the political policy and the educational concept, which the Edo bakufu (a Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) set forth, gave rise to the ideology of Kanzen Choaku.

sen.j: 江戸時代後期の文学作品によく用いられ、特に読本や人情本、歌舞伎などの作品に多く散見される。
sen.e: Kanzen Choaku was often adopted in the literature of the late Edo period and especially can be seen in fictional novels, popular novels, kabuki plays etc.
Kanzen Choaku was often adopted in the literature of the late Edo period and especially can be seen in fictional novels, popular novels, kabuki plays etc.
Kanzen Choaku was often adopted in the literature of the late Edo period and especially can be seen in fictional novels, popular novels, kabuki plays etc.

sen.j: 曲亭馬琴の『南総里見八犬伝』などが、勧善懲悪の代表作品としてよく挙げられる。
sen.e: "Nanso Satomi Hakkenden" (The story of eight samurai dogs and a princess of the Satomi family in Nanso region) by Bakin KYOKUTEI is often referred to as a typical piece of Kanzen Choaku.
"Nanso Satomi Hakkenden" (The story of eight samurai dogs and a princess of the Satomi family in Nanso region) by Bakin KYOKUTEI is often referred to as a typical piece of Kanzen Choaku.
"Nanso Satomi Hakkenden" (The story of eight samurai dogs and a princess of the Satomi family in Nanso region) by Bakin KYOKUTEI is often referred to as a typical piece of Kanzen Choaku.

sen.j: 一方、『小説神髄』で坪内逍遥などは、勧善懲悪を説く小説を勧懲小説と呼び、時代遅れの産物であると否定している。
sen.e: However, in his book "Shosetsu Shinzui" (The essence of novels), Shoyo TSUBOUCHI rejected the novels which encourage Kanzen Choaku (he called them "Kancho novels") claiming them to be outdated.
However, in his book "Shosetsu Shinzui" (The essence of novels), Shoyo TSUBOUCHI rejected the novels which encourage Kanzen Choaku (he called them "Kancho novels") claiming them to be outdated.
However, in his book "Shosetsu Shinzui" (The essence of novels), Shoyo TSUBOUCHI rejected the novels which encourage Kanzen Choaku (he called them "Kancho novels") claiming them to be outdated.

sen.j: なお同書中において坪内は、模写小説にて人情を著す方を尊んでいる。
sen.e: In the book, TSUBOUCHI thinks it is more valuable to express human feelings in realistic novels.
In the book, TSUBOUCHI thinks it is more valuable to express human feelings in realistic novels.
In the book, TSUBOUCHI thinks it is more valuable to express human feelings in realistic novels.

sen.j: 悪としてよく扱われるのが、一般に強大な力を保持し、平和を乱し、正義を好まない人物や組織である。
sen.e: The evil in Kanzen Choaku stories is often a person or an organization which generally has great power, disturbs the peace and dislikes justice.
The evil in Kanzen Choaku stories is often a person or an organization which generally has great power, disturbs the peace and dislikes justice.
The evil in Kanzen Choaku stories is often a person or an organization which generally has great power, disturbs the peace and dislikes justice.

sen.j: 平和や正義という抽象的な概念は、人によって考え方は多様であるし、基準も曖昧である。
sen.e: Abstract concepts of peace or justice are interpreted in different ways from person to person and their definition is not clear.
Abstract concepts of peace or justice are interpreted in different ways from person to person and their definition is not clear.
Abstract concepts of peace or justice are interpreted in different ways from person to person and their definition is not clear.

sen.j: そのため、対象は作品によって異なるが、その時代を風刺していたり、または架空に作り上げたりと行った場合が多い。
sen.e: Therefore the subject matter varies from piece to piece, but many aim to lampoon the period in which they were produced or are works of fiction.
Therefore the subject matter varies from piece to piece, but many aim to lampoon the period in which they were produced or are works of fiction.
Therefore the subject matter varies from piece to piece, but many aim to lampoon the period in which they were produced or are works of fiction.

sen.j: 勧悪懲悪（かんあくちょうあく）とは、勧善懲悪において、本来であれば悪に値する存在（強盗、殺し屋、闇金、女衒など）が様々な理由（猛悪に対する正義心や義侠心の発露、仲間の裏切りや取り分の相違、権力闘争、あるいは助平心など）によって、悪と対峙する立場になり、結果的に（他方の視点からして）悪を懲らしめる。
sen.e: In Kanaku Choaku, someone considered to belong originally to the evil side (e.g. bandit, hired killer, black-market lender, or woman trafficking broker) is put into a position in conflict with evil for many different reasons (e.g. the emergence of a feeling of justice or a chivalrous spirit against a greater evil, a peer's betrayal, a disagreement about the sharing of the spoils, a power struggle, or greed) and consequently punishes the greater evil (from the other's point of view).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In Kanaku Choaku, someone considered to belong originally to the evil side (e.g. bandit, hired killer, black-market lender, or woman trafficking broker) is put into a position in conflict with evil for many different reasons (e.g. the emergence of a feeling of justice or a chivalrous spirit against a greater evil, a peer's betrayal, a disagreement about the sharing of the spoils, a power struggle, or greed) and consequently punishes the greater evil (from the other's point of view).

In Kanaku Choaku, someone considered to belong originally to the evil side (e.g. bandit, hired killer, black-market lender, or woman trafficking broker) is put into a position in conflict with evil for many different reasons (e.g. the emergence of a feeling of justice or a chivalrous spirit against a greater evil, a peer's betrayal, a disagreement about the sharing of the spoils, a power struggle, or greed) and consequently punishes the greater evil (from the other's point of view).

sen.j: 勧善懲悪とピカレスクの融合による応用形。
sen.e: Kanaku Choaku is a combination of Kanzen Choaku and Picaresque and a variation of Kanzen Choaku.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Kanaku Choaku is a combination of Kanzen Choaku and Picaresque and a variation of Kanzen Choaku.
Kanaku Choaku is a combination of Kanzen Choaku and Picaresque and a variation of Kanzen Choaku.

sen.j: 義賊が典型的である。
sen.e: A Robin Hood figure is typical of Kanaku Choaku.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: A Robin Hood figure is typical of Kanaku Choaku.
A Robin Hood figure is typical of Kanaku Choaku.

sen.j: 必殺シリーズは「女たらしの按摩師」や「バイトで人斬りをする同心」が「金目当て」で悪と対峙する、というようにさらに「洗練」された形となっている。
sen.e: In the Japanese TV drama series "Hissatsu", the setting is more sophisticated in that the lead characters are a lady-killer masseur and a police constable who kills people as a side job, and they battle a greater evil for money.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the Japanese TV drama series "Hissatsu", the setting is more sophisticated in that the lead characters are a lady-killer masseur and a police constable who kills people as a side job, and they battle a greater evil for money.

In the Japanese TV drama series "Hissatsu", the setting is more sophisticated in that the lead characters are a lady-killer masseur and a police constable who kills people as a side job, and they battle a greater evil for money.

sen.j: ただし、単に双方とも悪というわけではなく、主人公側は人情が通じたり、合法的には裁けぬ悪を裁くなど心理的には善、もしくは善寄りである。
sen.e: However in Kanaku Choaku stories, both sides are not completely evil as the leading characters are psychologically good or tending towards goodness, for example they understand human feelings or punish someone evil who cannot be legally punished.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However in Kanaku Choaku stories, both sides are not completely evil as the leading characters are psychologically good or tending towards goodness, for example they understand human feelings or punish someone evil who cannot be legally punished.

However in Kanaku Choaku stories, both sides are not completely evil as the leading characters are psychologically good or tending towards goodness, for example they understand human feelings or punish someone evil who cannot be legally punished.

sen.j: 懲罰手段が悪、若しくは所属が悪と同じだけの勧善懲悪であるとも言える。
sen.e: In this sense, Kanaku Choaku can be regarded as Kanzen Choaku but with the punishing method being evil or the main character belonging to an evil side.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In this sense, Kanaku Choaku can be regarded as Kanzen Choaku but with the punishing method being evil or the main character belonging to an evil side.
In this sense, Kanaku Choaku can be regarded as Kanzen Choaku but with the punishing method being evil or the main character belonging to an evil side.

sen.j: また、勧善懲悪とされるものでも、容赦なく悪人を殺し続ける場合などがあるため、勧悪懲悪との差異は明確ではない。
sen.e: Also in some works regarded as Kanzen Choaku, the "good" side indiscriminately kills evil people without mercy, thus the difference between Kanzen Choaku and Kanaku Choaku is not clear.
Also in some works regarded as Kanzen Choaku, the "good" side indiscriminately kills evil people without mercy, thus the difference between Kanzen Choaku and Kanaku Choaku is not clear.
Also in some works regarded as Kanzen Choaku, the "good" side indiscriminately kills evil people without mercy, thus the difference between Kanzen Choaku and Kanaku Choaku is not clear.

sen.j: この他、『ルパン三世』のアニメ版諸作品でも、泥棒である主人公一味が結果的に一国や地球的な規模の巨悪までをも粉砕する展開が少なからず見られる。
sen.e: Besides these, in various works of "Lupin III" of the animated cartoon version, lead characters of thieves often unintentionally defeat huge, nationwide or earth-scale evils.
